__TOC__

As part of the AsiaBusinessTour, Canonical representatives plan to visit Taipei, Taiwan on 16 and 17 February 2006. If you have information or contacts to help us plan this trip, please fill in the relevant sections below, or contact us at asia2006@canonical.com

Please see http://wiki.tossug.org/UbuntuTaipei2006 for up to date information on the Taipei trip. -- Ping

Who to Meet

Technology Companies (e.g., contacts at OEMs, system builders, etc.)

*** VIA
*** Liteon
*** Quanta
*** ...

Government (e.g., contacts in ministries of education, culture, information technology)

*** Research, Development and Evaluation Commission
*** National Science Council

Linux User Groups (LUG) (e.g., we would love to meet with members of the community, so let us know if there are any meetings while we are there)

*** <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.org.tw/|ubuntu-tw]]</nowiki>
*** <nowiki>[[http://wiki.tossug.org/|Taipei Open Source Software User Group]]</nowiki>

Universities (e.g., contacts in computer science/information technology departments)

*** National Taiwan University

Volunteers

If you would like to help us navigate during our stay in Taipei, Taiwan please let us know by signing up below or sending us an email to the address at the top of this page.

*** The contacts in Taipei are <nowiki>[[mailto:kc.free@gmail.com|K.C. Chen]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[mailto:BlueT@ubuntu.org.tw|BlueT]]</nowiki>.  Any suggestions or questions?  Please <nowiki>[[mailto:kc.free@gmail.com|contact K.C. directly]]</nowiki>.

Where to Stay

Last but not least, any suggestions of decent hotels/accomodation would be extremely helpful! We are particularly looking for someplace

*** convenient to airports
*** convenient for local businesses
*** appropriate to host a business breakfast
*** well-wired (i.e, broadband!)
